para.p:
Let
: χ
→ Z C
be a primitive Dirichlet character modulo
m
.
χ
being a Dirichlet character modulo
m
means that
=
⁢ χ
(
⁢ k n
)
⁢ χ
( k )
χ
( n )
for all
k , n
, that
=
⁢ χ
(
+ n m
)
⁢ χ
( n )
for all
n
, and that if
>
gcd
( n , m )
1
then
=
⁢ χ
( n )
0
.
χ
being primitive means that the conductor of
χ
is
m
. The conductor of
χ
is the smallest defining modulus of
χ
. If
m ′
is a divisor of
m
,
m ′
is said to be a defining modulus of
χ
if
=
gcd
( n , m )
1
and
≡ n
1
(
mod
m ′
)
together imply that
=
⁢ χ
( n )
1
. If
≡ n
1
(
mod m
)
then
=
⁢ χ
( n )
1
(sends multiplicative identity to multiplicative identity), so
m
is a defining modulus, so the conductor of a Dirichlet character modulo
m
is less than or equal to
m
.

We shall prove the Polya-Vinogradov inequality for primitive Dirchlet characters. The same inequality holds (using an
O
term rather than a particular constant) for non-primitive Dirichlet characters. The proof of that involves the fact [, p. 152, Proposition 8] that a divisor
m ′
of
m
is a defining modulus for a Dirichlet character
χ
modulo
m
if and only if there exists a Dirichlet character
χ ′
modulo
m ′
such that

Math.text: formulae@(chi * n = ((chi _ 0 * n) cdot chi ^ prime) * n, n element-of Z)

para.p:
where
χ 0
is the principal Dirichlet character modulo
m
. (The principal Dirichlet character modulo
m
is that character such that
=
⁢ χ
( n )
0
if
>
gcd
( n , m )
1
and
=
⁢ χ
( n )
1
otherwise.)

If
χ
is a Dirichlet character modulo
m
, define the Gauss sum
:
⁢ G
( ⋅ , χ )
→ Z C
corresponding to this character by

Math.text: formulae@(G * open-interval@(n, chi) = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ (m - 1))@(chi * k * e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m)), n element-of Z)

para.p:
The Polya-Vinogradov inequality states that if
χ
is a primitive Dirichlet character modulo
m
, then

Math.text: absolute-value@((sum _ (n less= N))@(chi * n)) less square-root@(m) * logarithm@(m)

para.p:
We can write
⁢ χ
( n )
using a Fourier series (the Fourier coefficients are defined on the following line, and one proves that any function
→
/ Z m
C
is equal to its Fourier series)

Math.text: hat@(chi) * k = (1 / m) * ((sum _ (n = 0)) ^ (m - 1))@(chi * n * e ^ (- (2 * pi * i * k * n) / m)) = (1 / m) * G * open-interval@(- k, chi)
hat@(chi) * k
(1 / m) * G * open-interval@(- k, chi)

para.p:
We use the fact [, p. 152, Proposition 9] that for any
n
we have
=
⁢ G
( n , χ )
⁢
⋅
⁢
¯ χ
( n )
G
( 1 , χ )
. This is straightforward to show if
=
gcd
( n , m )
1
, but takes some more work if
>
gcd
( n , m )
1
(to show that
=
⁢ G
( n , χ )
0
in that case). Using
=
⁢ G
( n , χ )
⁢
⋅
⁢
¯ χ
( n )
G
( 1 , χ )
, we get

Math.text: chi * n = ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ (m - 1))@((((1 / m) * overline@(chi * (- k))) cdot G) * open-interval@(1, chi) * e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m)) = ((G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ (m - 1))@(overline@(chi * (- k)) * e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m))

((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(chi * n) = ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(((G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ (m - 1))@(overline@(chi * (- k)) * e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m))) = ((G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ (m - 1))@(overline@(chi * (- k)) * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m))) = ((G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ (m - 1))@(overline@(chi * (- k)) * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m)))
((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(((G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ (m - 1))@(overline@(chi * (- k)) * e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m)))
((G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 0)) ^ (m - 1))@(overline@(chi * (- k)) * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m)))
((G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ (m - 1))@(overline@(chi * (- k)) * ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(e ^ ((2 * pi * i * k * n) / m)))

para.p:
Let
=
⁢ f
( k )
∑
= n 1
N
e
/
⁢ 2 π i k n
m
. Thus

Math.text: ((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(chi * n) = ((G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ (m - 1))@(overline@(chi * (- k)) * f * k)

para.p:
and so (because
|
¯
⁢ χ
(
- k
)
|
is either
1
or
0
and hence is
≤
1
)

Math.text: absolute-value@(((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(chi * n)) = (absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) * ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ (m - 1))@(absolute-value@(f * k))

para.p:
We have
=
⁢ f
(
- m k
)
¯
⁢ f
( k )
, so
=
|
⁢ f
(
- m k
)
|
|
⁢ f
( k )
|
. Hence

Math.text: ((sum _ (k = 1)) ^ (m - 1))@(absolute-value@(f * k)) less= 2 * (sum _ (1 less= k less= m / 2))@(absolute-value@(f * k))

para.p:
Moreover, for
1 ≤ k ≤
/ m 2
we have, setting
= r
e
/
⁢ 2 π i k
m
,

Math.text: absolute-value@(f * k) = absolute-value@((1 - r ^ (N + 1)) / (1 - r)) less= 2 / absolute-value@(1 - r) = 1 / sine@((pi * k) / m) less= 1 / ((2 / pi) cdot ((pi * k) / m)) = m / (2 * k)

Math.tex: \displaystyle\left|\sum_{n=1}^{N}\chi(n)\right|\leq\frac{|G(1,\chi)|}{m}\cdot 2% \sum_{1\leq k\leq m/2}|f(k)|\leq\frac{|G(1,\chi)|}{m}\cdot 2\sum_{1\leq k\leq m% /2}\frac{m}{2k}=|G(1,\chi)|\sum_{1\leq k\leq m/2}\frac{1}{k}<|G(1,\chi)|\log m.
Math.text: absolute-value@(((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(chi * n)) less= ((absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) cdot 2) * (sum _ (1 less= k less= m / 2))@(absolute-value@(f * k)) less= ((absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) cdot 2) * (sum _ (1 less= k less= m / 2))@(m / (2 * k)) = absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) * (sum _ (1 less= k less= m / 2))@(1 / k) less absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) * logarithm@(m)
absolute-value@(((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(chi * n))
((absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) cdot 2) * (sum _ (1 less= k less= m / 2))@(absolute-value@(f * k))
((absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) / m) cdot 2) * (sum _ (1 less= k less= m / 2))@(m / (2 * k))
absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) * (sum _ (1 less= k less= m / 2))@(1 / k)
absolute-value@(G * open-interval@(1, chi)) * logarithm@(m)

para.p:
(If
m
is large enough. It’s not true that
≤
∑
1 ≤ k ≤
/ m 2
1 k
log
(
/ m 2
)
, but it is true for large enough
m
that
<
∑
1 ≤ k ≤
/ m 2
1 k
log m
.)

It is a fact [, p. 154, Proposition 10] that if
χ
is a primitive Dirichlet character modulo
m
and
=
gcd
( n , m )
1
then
=
|
⁢ G
( n , χ )
|
m
. Thus

Math.text: absolute-value@(((sum _ (n = 1)) ^ N)@(chi * n)) less square-root@(m) * logarithm@(m)
